transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi? This is Arjun calling from MongoDB, how are you today?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, speaking. I’m doing alright—thanks. How can I help?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Awesome, thanks for picking up! I’ll keep it brief—I noticed Acme Corp's been modernizing your microservices, and I wanted to see if you’ve considered MongoDB Atlas for your data layer?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, we’re pretty deep into DynamoDB at this point, so... probably not.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally get it. DynamoDB’s a solid choice. A lot of teams I talk to, though, hit limits with flexibility or multi-region scaling—has that come up for you at all?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Um, not really, honestly. We’re pretty happy with how things scale, and AWS covers our compliance. Multi-region is actually working fine for our use cases.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That’s great to hear. Out of curiosity—how’s your experience been with vendor lock-in or migrating workloads between clouds? Is that a concern at all for Acme down the line?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’re pretty much all-in on AWS, to be honest. The switching costs would be huge and, uh, we’ve got a long-term contract. Migration risk is just not something leadership wants to entertain.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Makes total sense, Zhi. Fair to say you wouldn’t be open to exploring other options, even if it meant more flexibility on contract terms or support for multi-cloud in the future?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really, no. We just renewed our AWS agreement—frankly, our leadership’s pretty strict about keeping everything consolidated. Plus, our teams are already trained up on Dynamo.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Got it, yeah. And I imagine pricing is probably another factor—it can look expensive to move, for sure?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, exactly. The cost to re-architect, retrain, and migrate... it’s just not justifiable right now. We’d need a serious reason to jump ship.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally appreciate the candor, Zhi. If anything ever changes, or you want to benchmark Atlas for future projects, what’s the best way to check in—email, maybe?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: You can send info to my email, sure. But honestly, it’s not likely we’ll revisit this for at least a couple years.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: I appreciate you letting me know. I’ll send along my details, and if anything comes up, just reach out. Thanks for your time, Zhi!
